intro: Psychotria sanmartensis var. costanensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Costa Rica. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in montane rainforests. The species is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its foliage and floral display.
